video.title: Full Stack Todo List Tutorial using Vue.js & AdonisJs
video.description:
We are going to build a simple full stack todo list application using Vue.js for the front end and Adonis to implement the REST API. Also uses Vuetify.

Vue.js section starts at 1:11:14

Cody's Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsrVDPJBYeXItETFHG0qzyw
💻 Code: https://github.com/codyseibert/vue-adonis-todo
🐦 Follow Cody on twitter: https://twitter.com/CodyLSeibert

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Pedro J
topLevelComment.text:
Hi ... After having a registerError or loginError because of inserting wrong data, if you try once more to insert correct data, for every key pressed, an error is thrown in the browser console with something like this:

(after a registerError...)
[Vue warn]: Invalid prop: type check failed for prop "value". Expected Boolean, got String with value "An error has occured trying to create your account".

(after a loginError...)
[Vue warn]: Invalid prop: type check failed for prop "value". Expected Boolean, got String with value "An error has occured trying to login".

How to solve this? There is a way to send the request only when the Register/Login button is pressed and not for every key pressed?

topLevelComment.author: Pedro J
topLevelComment.text: Hi ... How to clear the STATE after the Logout to reset the loginEmail/registerEmail and loginPassword/registerPassword?

replies.author: Leonardo Dias

The "...mapGetters" is a Vuex thing. Read it on their documentation.

There's also the spread operator, which is a JS thing. read it on MDN.

topLevelComment.author: hakooplay Play
topLevelComment.text:
2:43 Install Adonis.js 
3:37 adonis new server 
8:20 adding routes to register 
10:15 adding make:controller User
17:17 adonis migrations 
20:00 adonis auth 
26:08 adonis make:model Project -m 
30:30 middleware auth in request 
47:04 adonis make:exception InvalidAccess
55:50 adonis make:controller Task 
1:11:15 Installing vue-cli 
1:12:16 vue create client 
1:13:49 yarn add axios loadash vuetify vuex-persistedstate vuex-router-sync 
1:15:05 include dependencies 
1:28:58 toolbar component 
1:31:31 register component 
1:38:48 add authentication.js 
1:50:35 axios in http.js 
1:54:06 devServer vue.config.js 
2:05:44 logout 
2:08:50 login  
2:14:55 projects panel component 
3:41:12 deploy 
3:45:00 server config 
3:47:40 pm2 server daemon

topLevelComment.author: hakooplay Play
topLevelComment.text: Actualy you could make route for resource like this:   Route.resource('projects', 'ProjectController').apiOnly().middleware('auth').formats(['json']); And create method should be named _store_ in this case

replies.author: hakooplay Play
replies.text: and nested tasks will be Route.resource('projects.tasks', TaskController')....

topLevelComment.author: Thomas Bruyer
topLevelComment.text:
I'm having serious problem to install the sqlite3 npm package. 

> sqlite3@4.0.0 install C:\code\todoAdonisVue\node_modules\sqlite3
> node-pre-gyp install --fallback-to-buildnode-pre-gyp ERR! Tried to download(403): https://mapbox-node-binary.s3.amazonaws.com/sqlite3/v4.0.0/node-v64-win32-x64.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp ERR! Pre-built binaries not found for sqlite3@4.0.0 and node@10.2.0 (node-v64 ABI, unknown) (falling back to source compile with node-gyp)


Any idea ?

replies.author: Thomas Bruyer
replies.text: I just found the github issue about it but thx anyway :p

topLevelComment.author: Lowbits - Media
topLevelComment.text:
Thank you for that. 
For the AuthorizationService, in laravel you would do it like that. user.projects.findOrFail(id). I hope they will do it in adonis as well.

edit:
you can do it that way
const projects = await user
  .projects()
  .wherePivot('user_id', user.id)
  .fetch()

then you will get the users projects.

topLevelComment.author: pantoffelheld14

replies.author: Dan Fletcher
replies.text: Very new to AdonisJS but I don't see any reason why you can't use whatever persistence layer you'd like to. No different than how Laravel doesn't' force you to use Eloquent. It might take a little bit more work, and you'll need to know what you're doing because there are probably fewer people going against the convention but you can do it.

replies.author: Dan Fletcher
replies.text: @Simran Preet Singh Exactly and if you have both then go polyglot. Or forget thinking about it and use Prisma lol

replies.author: Simran Preet Singh
replies.text:
@Not2Day databases are not language specific. If you have relational data use SQL based DB, if you have non relational data use some no SQL DB. 
Language can either Javashit or Java or C# or Python etc

replies.author: Not2Day
replies.text: for javascript development I think mongodb is better. For anything else though I think sql is good.
